prospect.companyOverview: Acme Corporation is a mid-sized staffing and recruitment firm specializing in technology placements across North America. They manage approximately 500 active job openings and work with 200+ corporate clients.

contact.name: Jane Smith
contact.title: VP of Operations
contact.background: Jane has 12 years of experience in recruitment operations and technology. She previously worked at a larger staffing firm before joining Acme 3 years ago to help modernize their operations.
relevantExperience: Led digital transformation initiatives at previous company
Strong advocate for automation and AI in recruitment

painPoints: Manual candidate screening consuming 40% of recruiter time
Inconsistent candidate experience across different recruiters
Difficulty tracking candidate engagement and communication history
High administrative burden preventing recruiters from focusing on relationships
Growing competition from larger firms with better technology
opportunities: Strong interest in AI-powered automation to improve efficiency
Existing technical infrastructure makes integration easier
Recent funding round provides budget for technology investments
Pain points align perfectly with MyRecruiter's core value proposition
insights.competitivePosition: Acme is a established regional player competing against both larger national firms with better technology and smaller boutique firms with deeper specialization. They're at an inflection point where technology investment could be a key differentiator.
insights.decisionMakingProcess: Jane has significant influence as VP of Operations, but final budget approval likely requires CEO sign-off. Decision timeline appears to be 30-60 days based on their stated urgency and budget cycle timing.

talkingPoints: Reference the successful referral and how that customer improved recruiter efficiency by 35%
Emphasize AI-powered candidate screening and how it reduces manual work by 40%+
Highlight conversational AI for candidate engagement and improved experience consistency
Position MyRecruiter as a competitive advantage against larger firms
Discuss integration with their existing ATS and smooth implementation process
questionsToAsk: What percentage of your recruiters' time is spent on manual screening vs. relationship building?
How do you currently measure candidate experience and engagement?
What's been the biggest challenge in previous technology implementations?
What would success look like 6 months after implementing an AI solution?
Who else should be involved in evaluating this solution?
What's your current budget cycle and timeline for making this decision?
objectionHandling: Cost concerns: Focus on ROI through time savings and increased placements, offer pilot program to demonstrate value
Integration complexity: Highlight seamless API integrations and dedicated implementation support
Recruiter adoption: Share case studies of successful change management and training programs
AI accuracy concerns: Explain human-in-the-loop design and customizable screening criteria
Data security: Provide SOC 2 compliance documentation and security architecture overview
nextSteps: Schedule 30-minute demo focused on candidate screening automation
Share case study from similar-sized staffing firm (150-200 employees)
Provide ROI calculator customized to their recruiter headcount
Arrange technical discovery call with their IT team if needed
Send proposal within 3 business days of demo

sources.description: Company website - services, about page, and careers section
Jane Smith's LinkedIn profile - background and experience
Input context from sales rep - pain points and referral information
